inn1.comm: gentle movement at a gentle pace. Fullish length swinging into middle and leg, van Wyk watches carefully and pushes to midwicket with the angle
fuller on this occasion. Better length too, just outside off. Van Wyk looks to drive but gets a thick inside edge to square leg
another thick inside edge which flies down to fine leg. Gentle seam movement into the left hander on middle and leg this time.
131.6 ks, much fuller again inviting some swing. Not prodigious movement, but enough to keep Amla quiet. Hashim gets on the front foot and defends
angled across the right-hander this time. Not much movement. Well outside off and Amla shoulders arms.
good finish, fullish once more on off. Amla gets on the front foot and plays a solid forward defensive shot to mid-on
full on leg stump, van Wyk pushes with the angle to mid-on. Real loosener that, should have been put away.
better stuff from Milne. A bit of out swing to the right-hander but it is rather wide outside the off stump. Van Wyk leaves it be
short of a length but well outside the off stump once more. Just a hint of away shape and Van Wyk sees no reason to play out there
144.5 kph, back of a good length but straighter. Van Wyk stays on the back foot and defends
more away shape from the right-hander outside off. But MvW is not playing out there. Milne has to bring the line closer to the stumps
corrects his line nicely. Good length delivery on off and middle stump. MvW gets a good stride forward to block under his eyes. Maiden.
135.1 ks, good length straying on Amla's pads which is extremely dangerous. Amla clips nicely but the short midwicket fielder does well to stop it
back of a length swinging into middle and off, Amla stays back in his crease and pushes with the angle to midwicket
drifting on Amla's pads again who surprisingly misses the flick. Hits his thigh pad and rolls away to square leg

picks the length very very early, gets into position and deposits the length delivery over the midwicket region. Just a bit short but MvW picked it very early and played a nice flat-batted pull. Didn't bother keeping ti down
angled across the right-hander this time on a fullish length. Van Wyk lets it go
126 ks, short ball angled across the right-hander once more outside the off stump. Van Wyk bails out of the pull and leaves it
full length on off stump. Amla stays on the front foot to block
nicley clipped, Amla's trademark shot. Wristily takes the ball from outside off to flick to the right of mid-on for an easy single
145.7 ks, generating good pace here Milne. Good length delivery on middle, Morne is hustled for pace but manages a thick inside edge to square leg

gets a hold of that! But almost falls back on his stumps too. Stays back, anticipating the shorter length and it is right where he wants it, Van Wyk heaves it with the pace and angle over backward square leg
better change of line, slightly fuller and outside off stump. Van Wyk shoulders arms
sticks to that line. Good length delivery outside off, not much swing or seam for Milne in that over. Van Wyk watches carefully as he decides to leave
beaten. Beautiful delivery. Angled across the right-hander again, Amla shuffles across and defensively prods at it but is beaten on the outside edge
oh, Amla punishes the slightly poor delivery. Just a bit full on off stump, and Amla is in position quickly to wristily work it through midwicket for a boundary. Don't bowl there to him.
slightly wider outside off on a good length, Amla skews it down to third man
fullish length on middle and off, Van Wyk calmly pats it into the leg side
poor delivery, would have been called wide had Morne not got bat on that. Very wide down leg, and Van Wyk tickles it to the fine leg region for two
too short this time, bangs it in halfway down and with the pace of the pitch, it loops easily over the batsman's head.

nicely played once more. not too much width, but enough for van Wyk to stay on the back foot and throw his hands at it, gets it to the right of point and an easy boundary on offer with the quick outfield
135 ks, not too quick but lovely lines just around off. Amla blocks with a straight bat
134.1 ks. Easy picking for Amla. He will score there all day. Drifting on a full length on leg stump and Amla needs no second invitation to flick in the air past square leg
poor lines once more, straying on middle stump which is wristily worked away into the gap at midwicket. Sodhi manages to cut it in just before the ball reaches the boundary
full outside off, van Wyk shuffles across the stumps to play like his partner but hits it back to the bowler instead.
pushed wider outside off on a good length, Van Wyk watchfully lets the ball go
136 ks, good length outside off, Morne walks down the track a couple of steps to put the bowler's length off. No room provided however and Morne van Wyk slaps the ball into the cover region
shortish length just outside off, Amla pushes into the off side off the back foot
nice lines these, just outside off stump. Not too much width either. Amla shoulders arms
just when I say that, Wheeler strays down leg. Called wide.
128 ks, gentle pace on middle and leg, I'd avoid bowling there to Amla. Solidly defended back to the bowler
133.2 ks, fuller outside off, better lines. Amla drives nicely but straight to mid-off
good short ball, well directed at the badge. Amla is hustled for pace once more and misses the pull.
and the bad line is punished without any trouble. Full length down the leg side, Amla gets some bat on it and the ball flies down to the fine leg boundary.
132.4 ks, fuller than a good length on middle and leg, van Wyk pushes to mid-on off the back foot. Looking for one but not hit too well
oooh, very close to off stump. In fact, bounces over it. Comes in from outside off, van Wyk watches nicely and decides to leave on length. Goes over the off stump
shorter length again outside off, steered to point off the front foot
129 ks, inside edge almost rolls back onto the stumps. Morne van Wyk comes down the track again but improvises well to defend the length delivery
very full outside off, no feet movement from Morne as he tries to drive into the off side. The in swing takes the ball with the angle towards mid-on after the skewed bat face met it
good length again just outside off. MvW pushes at the in swing and gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket. Maiden over
140 ks, nice pace from Milne. Good length on middle and leg which is pushed into the midwicket region for an easy single
takes off from a good length. Bowled on a good length outside off. van Wyk lets it go, withdraws is bat well too to avoid the ball hitting the bat
dropped.  Should have been taken. Good short ball towards MvW's throat who instinctively pulls but gets a thick top edge. Bracewell at fine leg runs around but cannot hold on. Spills a good chance
pushed wider outside off, Amla lets it go
fuller once more well outside off, Amla decides not to play at those and therefore lets the ball go

good delivery to end. Length delivery just outside off which rises from that length. Amla stands tall on the back foot and keeps it down with a good defensive stroke. Great bowling and well played too.
139 ks, full outside off, no movement whatsoever now. Morne presents the straight bat to block
slightly shorter outside off. Van Wyk lets it go once more. Good batting this from these openers
close to the off stump again. Morne leaves on length once more and the ball goes over the off stump.
pulled again and six again. Picks the length early yet again, and is in a good position early. The heave carries easily over backward square
gets beaten on the inside edge this time. Fuller outside off, coming in with the angle. Maybe a bit of in swing. Morne looks to drive exuberantly but is beaten

almost beaten on the inside edge once more, instead gets a thick inside edge which evades the stumps and races to the fine leg boundary. Good length delivery just outside off, and Morne decides to defend watchfully but a bit of swing helps take the inside egde
good length delivery once more on off and middle, Amla stands tall once more and watchfully blocks back to the bowler off the back foot
fuller than a good length outside off, generating some extra pace. Amla lets the wide delivery go
good lines these, 147 ks, on off stump fuller than a good length. Amla pushes to mid-on with good use of the wrists
good-looking stroke once more down the ground. Not well timed though. Fuller on off stump, skewed past mid-on for a single
149 kph, excellent pace from Milne. Hustling MvW who awkwardly leaves the outside off delivery
takes off again from a good length. Some quizzical looks at the pitch but it is an excellent surface to bat on. Well wide outside off and therefore easily left
another inside edge  which just misses the stumps. Tentatively played from Amla there but it a good fifth-stump line. Rolls to fine leg
fuller length outside off, positively driven to cover
decent lengths again outside off. van Wyk shuffles across but gets a thick inside edge onto his body
brought in to the right-hander again. Some good pace too. Van Wyk is hit on the body once more from outside off
pushed wider outside off but some in-swing. MvW watchfully lets it go this time
moves across to the off stump again. Wider outside off though, and he leaves the good length delivery again.
excellent stuff continues from Milne. Tight fifth-stump line, Amla stays back and blocks with a straight bat. Well played again
148.2 ks, great lines these. Commendable stuff. Amla leaves on line and length which is fuller than a good length
147.7 ks, worked from the fifth-stump line to mid-on with exemplary use of the wrists. Did not find the gap though and therefore no runs either
151.1 ks now. Amla is having no trouble though, makes batting look so easy who leaves the fullish length outside off.
just a touch of width and Amla throws his hands at it but finds point. A bit short too

148.8 kph, five good deliveries but one is all Amla needs to use the over well. A bit fuller outside off, and Amla cover-drives elegantly. Imagine a typical Amla cover-drive and now imagine one with timing. Great execution, just used the pace to find the gap. Opened the face of the bat just in time too
a bit short to begin outside off, enough time for MvW to stay on the back foot and cut to the sweeper
short again, and punished with no trouble once more. Amla stays back and opens the face of the bat to find the gap at point for four
a bit short once more, pushed out to cover for one off the front foot
85.5 ks, very full outside off, squirted out back to the bowler off the front foot
nicely bowled this time. Nice ball that. Flighted outside off, spinning away from the right-hander. MvW is beaten on the drive
fullish on middle and off stump, MvW gets down early to play the sweep and connects well but finds short fine leg. Slips a little while playing the stroke.
inside edge past the keeper this time. interesting shot. Just a gentle outswinger to begin outside off, Amla drives but gets another thick edge which evades the keeper
drifting on Amla's pads this time who whips neatly to fine leg
just some gentle movement, not much outside off. MvW pushes to cover
122 ks, shorter this time on off stump. MvW stays back and blocks
tries the shorter delivery and the change in length surprises MvW. Although, he isn't hustled for pace, he cannot play a shot to that. Lets the ball go
119 kph, some more away swing. But a lot wider outside off, MvW leaves nicely again.
good line there, some drift too. On off stump, Amla stays back and tucks to midwicket
a bit of width this time outside off, Amla cuts nicely to point
fuller outside off, neatly driven to the swepeer off the overpitched delivery
short again outside off, MvW stays back and cuts to the sweeper off the back foot
some spin there, but straying on Amla's pads off the good length. HA clips to square leg
fuller this time and closer to the off stump but MvW picks the legspinner and lets the ball go
gentle away movement well outside off, Amla sees no reason to flirt at those balls and hence leaves it be
he makes the bowler bowl to him and that is a perfect example. Elliott drifts on Amla's pads who wont't miss out on scoring opportunities. Tickles to fine leg
touch closer to MvW on a good length, who works to short third man off the back foot
fuller on a fourth-stump line with some away swing. MvW can't find runs but can find point
thick outside edge this time, but MvW opened the face to try to get it there. Rolls towards third man and they scamper through for two.
outside off again, cut away past point for an easy brace
angling down leg, not quite as much turn as he might have hoped for to save grace. Nudge off his pads to short fine leg. Good effort from Milne there
looped up on off stump, plants his front leg forward, gets too close to the ball and drills it to short cover
very full again, this time on middle, pushed back at the bowler
eesh, thats a full toss and van Wyk slices it away to the sweeper on the off side
goes back to a good length ball, and has to hurry into the slap towards point

sublime shot! A few more like that and we will have a leader in this game, for sure. Picked the overpitched delivery, relished the width on offer and hits a lovely cover drive. Well to the right of the man in the deep there

ripped him open! A lazy little trot down the track from van Wyk, but he cant get to the pitch. Then commits the mistake of closing the face. Elliott pitches an awayswinger on a lovely, fuller length and jerks it away past the outside edge
that, on the other hand, is very easily dealt with. Far too short from a medium-pacer and van Wyk picks it away to the long leg boundary
forced to shorten his length because van Wyk was walking at him, and moving across as well. Picked away behind square leg
good length ball just outside off, teasing him into a drive on the up. Amla wont be lulled

thats an inside edge! Some encouragement from the bowler, both from the pitch and from his fielders. This back of a length delivery just held its line and exploited the gap between bat and pad as Amla plays an uncertain defensive. Single to long leg
goes for a pull, and gets into the shot  way too early. Struck on the belly
nicely flighted in on middle and leg, Amla is forward to block. Gets an inside edge to short fine leg
a little nip down the track, but Sodhi had flattened his trajectory well. Only gives Amla the opportunity to tuck it to midwicket
waits in his crease for the slower, flighted delivery. Sliced to point
leans into a pretty looking drive, but it is straight at cover. New Zealand like these dot balls building, and their keeper says as much
theres the release. Amla gets forward to the pitch of a tossed up delivery and drives to long-off
end of a good over from Sodhi, and its an excellent finish too. Continues with a fuller length, on off stump. Van Wyk respects it with a block

and thats that. A simple return catch. Reward for accurate bowling, because he made Amla do something other than normal. Got the batsman jumping quite a way outside off to take a good length ball and flick it through midwicket. All that happens is a leading edge pops back and gives Elliott and New Zealand their first wicket of the day
meets a back of a length delivery from the crease and taps it into the leg side
fuller delivery outside off, Rossouw waits on it and runs it to deep third man
walks across and exposes the leg stump, he looks most comfortable with his scoring shots on the leg side. This time it is only for a single off an inside edge onto thigh pad and to short fine leg
covers the line of a fuller delivery on middle and picks it off his toes to deep square leg

beautiful bowling. This Kingsmead pitch has a lot of juice in it if a 120kph bowler is getting it to carry through to the keeper at head-height. And there is away swing to boot, which means he beats van Wyk and his lazy poke into the leg side
starts well, targeting the off stump, with a shortish length. Defended
punches a back of a length delivery into the hands of short cover

leading edge lobs point, and there is a run-out chance as well. Loads of things happening all at once, and this is so so tight. The stymps are disturbed, but the bail takes an awful time to be dislodged. Amid that, the batsman despite a dive is still on the line. This might head into the old 'inconclusive' and 'benefit of the doubt to the batsman' area. Good ball too, gets extra bounce which makes his intended on-the-up drive take an edge and leap over point. Then deep third man comes into play, as does the SA batsmens greed in stealing a second. All is well for the hosts
peach! That holds its line and beats the new batsman. Lovely bowling, lovely captaincy to bring a frontline quick back

top work from Bracewell. Definitely looks like he wants to make up for that dropped catch. Throws himself at the ball scurrying away to the point boundary, well to the right of him. Runs across, gives everything and prevents a good cut shot to a pretty bad ball from getting just rewards

taken! Good job keeping the slip in. New Zealand have created a clear advantage here. Lovely delivery, demanding if the new batsman was aware of his off-stump. He wasnt particularly. Pokes at the ball with hard hands and Latham takes a good, low chance
walks at the bowler and defends just outside off
keeps a fullish length, a few inches outside off because he knows van Wyk keeps moving across. Left alone
shortish on middle and leg, nudged to square leg and they nip a couple since the region is unmanned
deep midwicket gets a workout again as van Wyk clips a good length ball on middle away

big appeal, and it did look so close! Did AB get a bat on this? No. What saved him from an lbw here? Elliott keeps bowling those deceptively slow legcutters. This one hits him on the back leg, right in front of middle stump. AB was stuck in the crease and was opened up, he was looking to play around the ball and into the leg side. HawkEye says it would have been umpires call because it was just clipping the middle bail
back of a length and just outside off, AB waits on it and dabs it past a wide slip fielder
shortish and outside off, van Wyk decides he does not want anything on it
good length on middle and off, defended with a closed face again
walks across and at the bowler, but Bracewell does not allow van Wyk the runs he wants on the leg side. All he can do is shoulder arms
steps down the track and tucks a good length ball into the midwicket region
fuller delivery on middle, AB covers the line and blocks with soft hands
oopsy, that is a consequence of the batsman wandering around his crease. Van Wyk is showing off his leg stump and Elliott wants to make sure he strays even further wide of off. Ends up with a wide
good length ball on fourth stump, but with van Wyk shuffling across, he is able to flick it through square leg

that time he stays put and cuts a short ball outside off towards the point boundary. Looked ready for a boundary until the fielder puts in a desperate dive. Bracewell again, lovely fielding, but it still gives van Wyk a fifty. A little scratchy, but he has held on
strays short and outside off, van Wyk was nipped towards it, showing his stumps while doing so, and pulls to deep midwicket
nicely timed flick from AB, but it is the placement that gets him his runs Bisects deep square leg and deep midwicket
presents the full face to a full ball on off stump
opens the face on impact as he slices a full and wide delivery to deep point
just a shade back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
hits the deck hard and attacks on and around off stump at 126kph, defended
goes for the bouncer outside off, and has put in way too much effort. Kingsmead is giving bounce away for free, Bracewell doesnt need to try that hard. And now he has to try again
mistimed straight drive from AB, mid-off is on hand to keep it to a single

fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off. But this is risky, very risky. Ran with the shot, but Williamson from short cover cut across, took it with one hand and looked set to create the run-out. Except he had dived, was on the ground, off balanced and he misses the throw
drilled down the ground, but the NZ fielding is top-class again. George Worker tracks it down, throws himself after the ball head-first, and pulls it back
thats short and van Wyk rolls on his back foot and pulls to long leg. Moving across outside off is helping him create his favoured scoring areas in the leg side
terribly close to a wide, but I suppose there is some leeway to the bowler since van Wyk is leaping outside off to play the ball
fuller delivery outside off, van Wyk is across again for a push through the off side. Angled face and getting into into the shot too early means he gets an inside edge to long leg
fuller delivery on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
banged in short and way outside off, considering all that van Wyk could have hoisted it over the off side. Instead he goes for a pull and looks ugly when he misses
walks across onto off stump and gets a leading edge to cover. Good length from Elliott, pulling it back but not quite going short
full on middle, nudged to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, tapped to backward point. Guptill has to move to his left, throws himself across to stop the ball from passing him, and then hits the stumps too. AB was safe though
waits for the back of a length ball to come to him, nearly passes him, before he runs it to third mna
fuller delivery nips away off the seam and beats a tentatively poking van Wyk
tapped straight at point this time, Guptill more than up to the task
back of a length on middle and leg, tapped into the midwicket region

nearly carries to short midiwcket! Goes for the flick against a full delivery on middle, timed well enough, but he might be thanking his luck that he didnt get all of this or it might have landed in Latham's lap
perfect bowling, full and right on off stump, to keep AB quiet. At least early in his innings
just back of a length on off stump, AB defuses it carefully. There is still a lot of time left to bat
width offered and AB leans into a crunch of a drive through the covers. Concentrating on playing it late, and timing the ball rather than flaying at it
good length on off stump, but with van Wyk moving across, he is able to open up a gap at midwicket

powerful hit, and if we are being nit-picky, that was a return catch. But seriously, this was coming in quite low, Elliott was in his followthrough. Not to mention AB had nailed this. So all in all, that was well stopped
back of a length, holds in the pitch and nips away off the seam. Beats de Villiers and his little dab to third man
shortihs and outside off, oddly enough that doesnt bounce as much as it should. Plays a chop and misses
picks out point as he tries to cut a shortish delivery outside off
fuller length on middle stump, van Wyk defends

that is the length he is most comfortable with, the short one with some room to pull. Gets a single to deep midwicket, and as he reaches the safety of the other end, he seems to slap the air with the bat in disappointment
catch, they yell. But AB has just enough power to beat the leaping short midwicket. This was clearly mistimed, this was a shot to dispel the pressure, to stop the walls from closing in. It comes off
ohhh, this is authoritative. What a shot to go reach his 8000th ODI run, fastest to that mark. Runs down the track and flat-bats a short ball away to the midwicket boundary
good length ball outside off, not bothered with

loads of extra bounce there, this was only 116 kph too. Elliott presents an excellent seam, hits the pitch with it and leaps away from the outside edge. Van Wyk was walking across, closing the face and is lucky not to nick off

now he does. Elliott has been tremendous for New Zealand today! Hits the deck, gets extra bounce, moves the ball away. Van Wyk is jumping across looking for midwicket, the edge is taken and pops to the slip fielder, who has been kept in the 31st over. Williamson and his team are doing a very good job keeping things even here
back of a length on middle and leg, defended
pushes it full on leg stump, and gets some shape away towards that slip fielder who is still in there. Miller is opened up as he strives to present a straight bat
full and curling in on middle, whipped away to deep square leg
full and wide outside off, Miller lets it go so his team can collect the extra

gets the ball to swing in late, but Miller was able to get in line with it and flick it away past mid-on. Sodhi was the man who was sluggish to get across, dives over the blal as well, and once it breached the infield, Elliott had too much work to do. Gets to the ball, yes, but while pulling it back, it hits his boot and dribbles onto the boundary
good length ball outside off, Miller is forward with a push. Gets an outside edge to third man
he is into the groove now! Poor ball, yes but the way in which he dismissed it - leans forward and smeared through the covers - indicates New Zealand better get their plans in order
jumps down the track, Wheeler pulls his length back and tucks him up on leg stump. Without any room, AB looks quite uncomfortable as he nudges it through midwicket
good length ball outside off, defended just in front of point
back of a length and outside off, defended with soft hands
keeps the ball full, in the hopes that it might curl away late, AB covers that probability and flicks it wide of long-on
banged in short, and seeing as Miller is new at the crease, he can get away with it. The only problem though, it was down leg
some nip back in a the batsman, who works the ball away to deep square leg
short and wide outside off, crisply hit to the sweeper
back of a length and on off stump, nudged towards square leg
full on off stump, driven to mid-off

ooh, outside edge! AB was into the push way too early, thats what Elliott has been doing so well. Messing with the batsmans timing having bowled full and tight at the stumps. But this ball had wandered way too wide, and was dying as well to be a chance. That will be drinks as well, so Nikhil will join you as we head into the final overs
good length delivery to begin after drinks just outside off, angled in to the left-hander who pushes with soft hands towards mid-on and the pair set off for a quick single
short of a length outside off, AB sits back in his crease, lets the ball come to him before deflecting it to midwicket with soft hands
thick inside edge, fortuitous boundary again. The ball comes in a tad and Miller looks to steer to third man, but the edge takes it to the fine leg boundary
fuller and wider, driven to cover off the front foot
slightly fuller again but wide, Miller stays in his crease and creams the drive to the sweeper
tight line towards off stump, AB stays in his crease and blocks with a slightly angled bat towards first slip
full and wide once more, Miller looks to drive without much feet movement. The drive skews off to mid-off instead
overpitched outside off, Miller looks to drive with timing instead of smashing it. Hits nicely but mid-off runs to his left and cuts it off
beaten this time is AB. Rises from a good length outside off, AB rocks back to cut but the extra bounce takes it past AB's flaying bat
fuller outside off. Milne has been impressive today. AB stays in his crease, lets the ball come to him and plays it wide of slip for one
148 ks, beats Miller for pace and bounce. Too quick for David. Good length delivery which bounces over the off stump, and figuratively cuts Miller in half
straight again on a good length, skewed off to the midwicket region for a single
nicely tossed up on off to start, Miller gets down on one knee and sweeps nicely to deep square leg
rank long-hop and it's not the person you want to be bowling these to. AB stays back in his crease and lofts over midwicket with no fuss. Easy six runs. Picked the gap nicely.
flighted outside off, driven wide of cover for one
flight on leg this time, Miller skips down the track and works to square leg for one
well bowled, slightly flatter but fuller. AB crashes the drive to the sweeper. Nicely played
87 ks, flight outside off, Miller gets down on one knee and reverse-sweeps this time. Buut finds short third man
extra bounce again from a good length. Has been quite the norm today. AB looks to cut nut is beaten again. Flies through to Ronchi.
thick outside edge which flies short of third man. Fuller length outside off, AB looks to whack over mid-off but skews towards third man. Bracewell returns the throws quickly but AB is too quick
149 ks, misfield and that is four. Good length delivery outside off, Ab plays his trademark steer to third man with an angled bat. The fielder drives but it goes through
what a shot that is. Pleasure to watch. Bouncer on off stump, AB arches his back, gives himself room and deflects the ball over slip. Wow.
good comeback. Fuller than a good length outside off, AB stays in his crease and looks to defend but is beaten on the outside edge.
poor ball that to AB. He isn't going to miss out on these. He gets to his fifty also. What an innings this. Short and wide, Ab flays at the ball and hits it over point for four. Easy runs.
tossed up on off, Miller advances and looks to belt it over long-on but doesn't get enough. Hits it on the bounce to long-on
93 ks, flighted on leg stump, de Villiers works off his pads to short fine leg
short this time outside off, Miller stays back and crashes it through cover. The pair easily come back for two
super shot, gets to the pitch of the ball nicely and smashes the flighted delivery past the bowler for four. Changing gears now are these two.
drops short again, giving Miller ample room to stay back and cut to deep point
89.4 ks, fuller and wide. AB cuts off the front foot but finds point
leading edge, good length on middle and leg, Miller looks to work to leg but the leading edge carries to mid-off on the bounce. Very similar to the way he was dismissed in the second ODI
short ball outside off, AB advances to try and swipe into the leg side, bails out of the shot, called wide too
lets the ball come to him before guiding the length delivery with an angled bat past point, easy two for AB. Making it look easy
fullish outside off again, AB steers to third man as he normally does.
straying on Miller's pads this time who nudges with soft hands to deep square leg
130 ks, short and wide, AB tries to pull but it is too wide outside off. Bails out of the stroke again
slightly wide outside off, cut nicely past point but a very very lazy misfield by Milne at the sweeper lets it go through. Should have been just two. Lackadaisical stuff from NZ.

again poor stuff from NZ. Flighted on leg, Miller comes down to work on the leg side but rolls on the off side off his pads, Ronchi runs to it and fires a wide throw at the non-strikers end allowing them two.
worked off his pads to deep square leg
what a shot again. Flighted outside off, AB stays in his crease, opens the face of the bat and lofts the drive over cover for another easy boundary.
drifts down leg this time. Ronchi can't stop it either. Free runs for SA.
comes down the track with intent but gets too close to the pitch, pushes to mid-on for an easy single
short outside off, Miller rocks back and cuts in front of cover. Two more
another drop. Much, much harder chance to Guptill at midwicket. Miller comes down and belts the tossed up delivery in the air to midwicket. Guptill can't hold on. Was a chance though.
fuller length outside off, calmly angled to third man with an open face.
full on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Miller knows he hasn't hit it too well and therefore runs through for one.
big appeal, not given. Short on AB's ribs who tries to pull, but is hit on the forearm. Should not have been called wide.

got im this time. Make no mistake, this is a massive wicket for NZ. Slow delivery, slower than Bracewell's normal pace on a good length. AB looks to drive through cover but the ball sneaks through bat and pad and hits the off stump. Good change in pace does for the dangerous de Villiers. Can NZ claw back in this?
good length again on off stump. Behardien stays back in his crease and blocks.
fuller on off stump, not much reverse swing or away movement. Behardien works to midwicket with soft hands allowing them one.
133.8 ks, fullish length on off stump. Miller is squared up before skewing the ball to cover
full toss outside off, Behardien drives straight to cover
very good placement earns Behardien four. Overpitched outside off, FB squeezes the drive through point and third man nicely. Gets him four.
flatter on off stump, patted back to the bowler
flat again, outside off though. Behardien rocks back to cut but is beaten by the extra bounce
fuller this time with some flight, worked against the spin to deep midwicket. Looking for two but they won't get it.
the reverse sweep comes out! Very full outside off, Miller premeditates the shot and executes well but finds the fielder at short third man
short and wide, Behardien rocks back early and cuts behind backward point. Easy two for SA.
136 ks, short, wide and cut away behind backward point again. Third man is quick on it to keep them down to one however.
length on middle, Miller misses his flick as he is struck high on the stomach. Just seems to have lost some timing after the dismissal
short outside off, Miller is quick on the pull but doesn't hit it well enough towards square leg
short again outside off, not too quick this time and FB executes a nicely timed pull to deep square leg
just short of mid-off. Almost another wicket. Fuller outside off, Miller drives uppishly but doesn't time it nicely again but this time the lack of timing saves him.

gone, another wicket for NZ. Miller's scratchy innings comes to an end. Angled across Miller who pushes at the length delivery with no feet movement. A thick edge carries comfortably through to Ronchi
picks the full delivery nicely off his pads. Times it nicely in the air on the bounce to deep square leg
shorter this time on middle and leg, FB tucks nicely towards midwicket for an easy single.
almost gets through Wiese. Fullish on middle and leg, Wiese just manages to get bat on it down in time, they get one as the ball moves towards fine leg
nicely played. Short on leg, doesn't get up high enough and sits up for Behardien who pulls in the air past midwicket for a much-needed boundary.
length again on middle, Behardien stays back in his crease and Milne has him on his toes but Behardien blocks nicely with a straight bat

edged and dropped. Beautiful ball, Williamson is good too as he has a slip in place. Wiese pushes at the fuller length and gets a thick outside edge, Latham spills the chance as he is tumbling to his right. Should have been taken again.
full on his pads, Wiese works nicely off his pads into the midwicket region. Comfortable two.
fullish length outside off, Wiese drives but finds the fielder at point
banged in halfway down, aimed at Wiese's throat who pulls all along the ground to fine leg

nicely played once more. Great placement. Lets the short and wide delivery come to him, waits long enough before cutting in front of point. The outfield does the rest. Clever batting from Behardien once again.

another edge, another boundary. Doesn't carry to Ronchi though. May have been the slower delivery. In fact, it was the slower offcutter. Wiese looks to run it to third man but the edge takes it past Ronchi for four.
slowrer offcutter again, Wiese gets a lot more bat on the steer to third man this time
slightly short but wide. Behardien cuts well but finds the fielder at point
good change in length. Goes for the bumper. Behardien is rushed on the pull and therefore bails out of the stroke
pushed nicely past cover for one. A slightly fullish length helped him.
bouncer again on leg stump, Wiese pulls uppishly but on the bounce to the fine leg fielder
Milne does it again. Beautiful delivery forcing Wiese to 'smell the leather'. Pitches on a  good length or slightly shorter and bounces high. Wiese is rushed through the shot.
goes through again, good length outside off, Wiese doesn't play a shot this time however
goes fuller this time and straight, Wiese pushes tentatively to long-on
150 ks again, Behardien looks to give himself room and use the pace by deflecting the ball into the off side, fails to find connection though.
wild hoick by Behardien. Fullish length which just misses the leg stump, Ronchi is surprised by the movement after it beats the wild heave. Can't keep it in, allowing them four extras.
slighty wide and short. Smashed off the back foot straight to point
135 ks, Wiese is rushed on the shot again, a thick inside edge goes over leg stump.

gone this time. Wiese looks for a swipe over midwicket, but that may have been the offcutter which helps in taking Wiese's outside edge. He swung at that so hard that it carries to Sodhi at third man.
134 ks, full on off stump, Beahrdien is quick on the drive and hence squirts to midwicket. Just one
nicely played from Abbott. Good lengths and tight lines around off, Abbott plays to point with soft hands for one
got a hold of that nicely. Short on middle stump, FB stays in his crease and cross-bats the pull high in the air over square leg. Welcome boundary
follows that up with a really nice shot. Too full outside off, FB picks his gap and lofts the drive through cover and mid-off. Didn't try to hit it too hard which was the key to the timing.
143 ks, full outside off, Abbott looks to get FB back on strike but hits it nicely to cover

suicidal run but never there. Good length on off stump, Abbott pushes to cover and sets off for one. Behardien sends him back, the fielder at cover had plenty of time to take aim and hit but misses. Abbott was well short of the crease.
full and wide. Abbott misses the drive. Another dot
full and straight, Abbott manages to push to long-on this time for a single

great shot selection, picks the gap to perfection once more and executes really nicely. Too full outside off, Behardien stays back in his crease and creams the drive to the right of mid-off. Great shot
low full toss, looking for the yorker. Behardien can only pat it back to the bowler. Abbott will be on strike for the final over
125 ks, Abbott looks to heave instead of getting Behardien back on strike. Length outside off which goes past the edge
nicely done from Behardien. Wheeler drifts down leg, Behardien doesn't care, calls Abbott through for the bye, Ronchi misses the stumps
beautiful shot selection once again, brilliant  batting. Too full outside off, carved past cover off the front foot all along the ground. Vital runs these
squeezed off the front foot to deep square leg
good short ball again aimed at the badge, Abbott misses the pull. They don't run through this time.
Abbott pushes the length ball with soft hands into the cover region for one

gone of the last ball. Low full toss outside off, Behardien looks to smash it over long-off but gets more elevation than distance. Williamson settles under it nicely and takes a good catch to end the SA innings. Good cameo that from Behardien too.

inn2.comm: nice ball to start, good away movement on off stump. Guptill gets a good forward stride and pushes into the vacant cover region for a single
142.8 ks. Wide and full, but Latham wont play when it is so wide outside off. Good pace though
closer to of stump, maybe sixth-stump line. Latham watchfully lets the ball go
slightly shorter on this occasion, drags his length back to get Latham playing but the line is still wider outside off. Latham shoulders arms
full and wide, Latham chases after it and connects beautifully. The square drive flies past point for the first boundary of the innings.
143 ks, full again but a touch closer. Latham sees no reason to play and lets it go
short of a length on middle and off, no movement. Guptill dead-bats his block, the ball rolls back to his pads

played more watchfully, but a needless run there. Guptill plays the length delivery nicely to point and sets off for one. Rossouw at point picks up cleanly and fires an inaccurate throw. Latham may have made his ground though
140 ks, comes back in to the left-hander from a good length. Latham waits on the back foot and carves the ball down to third man with an open face
overpitched delivery on middle, attempting the yorker there. Guptill gets bat down on it rather late but pushes to mid-on
142.8 ks, very tight line around off. Guptill gets behind the line of the delivery and drives towards mid-off
pushed wider outside off, a hint of away shape on that occasion. Guptill leaves it be
full on a fifth-stump line. Just a hint of in swing. Latham pushes nicely to mid-off off the front foot with a good front stride
very full and wide, should have been put away there but Latham opts to let the ball go
drags his length back immediately, fuller and closer to off, but Latham plays the ball nicely off the front foot with soft hands to cover.
good length again on middle and leg, no swing there. Guptill defends into the leg side off the back foot
strays on Guptill's pads this time, probably a good delivery if there was some swing but there was none on that occasion. Guptill tucks off his pads backward of square for two.

would have been out with a direct hit, but Rossouw ,misses the stumps again. Guptill pats it close to his feet into the off side and immediately calls for one. Latham doesn't respond immediately and eventually does. Very needless that.
short, wide and cut away. But Guptill picks out the fielder at point. Rabada gets away with one
much better, full length on off stump. Guptill comes forward and blocks back to the bowler
138 kph, full again around middle and leg, Guptill misses the flick and that would have been close had it been slightly fuller. But a bit too high. Trickles to third man
excellent short ball. Hustles Latham for pace, hurries onto him and Latham awkwardly loops the pull towards fine leg. No fielder there. Great direction
136 ks, blocked off the front foot
143 ks, a touch closer to off stump. Guptill gets a thick outside edge which rolls down to third man all along the ground
133 kph, slightly shorter outside off. Guptill pushes with intent to cover off the back foot
picks the gap this time though. A bit short once more outside off, Guptill punches off the back foot but finds the gap this time through point.
145 ks, much better delivery, full and swinging away and the ball is straight too, Guptill is squared up but skews the ball to cover

edged and gone. Steyn strikes early. Beautiful delivery, a touch fuller than the boundary delivery. Guptill looks to punch again through the off side but a thick outside edge is comfortably accepted by van Wyk. Important wicket
nicely bowled first up by Dale. Very full, intentionally bowled full and straight without much swing, KW sees it early and drives to mid-on
excellent end. Full outside off, KW attempts a forward defensive but gets beaten on the outside edge.
136 ks, strays down leg. Called wide
nicely played off the front foot. A bit fuller outside the off stump, Latham gets a goo stride and plays a nice drive through the covers for two.
short again on middle, Latham works off his hips to midwicket off the back foot
142.6 ks, full on off, not much movement. KW defends off the front foot
135 ks, fullish length again. Williamson watchfully defends into the off side off the back foot
141.5 ks, full and straight once more. Fuller than previous deliveries though. KW blocks off the front foot
lets the ball come to him on this occasion and steers the ball to third man for one
145 kph, oooh, that is a special one. Bounce, pace, perfect line just outside off and KW is beaten. Nip away off the seam as well, but it is the lift from the Durban pitch that beats Williamson

outside edge, this time, but it is credit to Williamson who plays close to his body and meets the fuller ball right under his eyes that the ball lands short of second slip and goes wide of the man, David Wiese
hurtles in a yorker on off stump at 146 kph, and Latham just about jams his bat down. Steyn has a big grin on his face, he is certainly enjoying himself
good length ball on off stump, Latham inches forward to block into the covers
a shade shorter this time, but still not quite short enough for the batsman to camp back. Latham rides it to point. Scrambled seam from Steyn too
aha, the batsman has the final say in an excellent over. Just a tad too full from Steyn and Latham leans into a cover drive that defines timing and poise (probably more now that Sanga is off)

thats a solid stroke, Williamson knows that there is bounce in this time and he uses that to his advantage. Gets up off his toes and crunches the ball in front of point. But de Villliers keeps it to a single
ooh, he should not have flayed at one so wide outside off.
good length ball, cutting back in slightly to Latham, defended
eases forward to a 125 kph delivery just outside off and runs it to point
walks  at the bowler, who delivers a fuller length on middle. Latham whips it strongly to the left of short midwicket. But AB is the man there, diving across to prevent a possible boundary
keeps out a fuller ball targeting the stumps
lovely upright seam, hits the deck at a fuller length and cuts back in at the front pad as Williamson defends. No chance of lbw because Williamson was playing a shot
gets forward to a fuller delivery outside off and blocks to cover. Very very solid
lift for the big, burly fast bowler. This one, at 132 kph, is left alone outside off as KW waits on his back foot

well handled from KW, but there is steep and threatening bounce for the quicks here. Abbott makes it doubly count by bowling along the fourth stump. Williamson is off his feet, and with soft hands, runs it down to third man
just back of a length and outside off, blocked off the back foot
sneaks in the fuller ball outside off, Latham thinks this is an opportunity for the push through the covers. But Abbot manages to curl the ball back in late and gets the inside edge
fuller delivery on middle, Latham sends it back where it came from
waits on the back of a length delivery angled across him and slides it off the open face to third man
strays on the pads and Williamson makes him pay. Fine leg was quite fine, so KW puts a little more power into his wrists and sends it well wide of that man on his left
soft hands this time, to pick a quick single past the slips. Oh, this is versatile batting. Especially seeing as that was a pretty good ball, in the off stump channel
shortish and angled across the left-hander, who follows his captains example, waits on the ball and picks up a single behind point
misses out there as he shuffles across and cant get to a fuller ball going down leg. Wry smile from Williamson as he realises his mistake
slides down leg as he tries to bounce Latham.
keeps back and clips a short delivery off his hips to long leg
shortish delivery on and around off stump, but both these batsmen are expecting that. Hug the crease, use soft hands and swindle a single towards point
none on offer there as Abbott bowls a touch fuller and makes Latham push into the covers

yes, but Latham has handled it supremely well. Dug into the middle of the deck, but Latham has watched it clearly, rolls on his back foot to keep his balance, and rolls his wrists as well, to keep the ball down and find the gap behind square leg
back of a length and just outside off, defended past point
137 kph, gets across on off stump to work a shortish delivery to mid-on
hangs back, angles the bat and dabs the ball to deep third man, who seems to  be the sub Dean Elgar (Dale Steyn is off the field)

vociferous appeal from Wiese, and it seems he might have run out Latham at the non-strikers. Seeing as the bowler immediately went up, this seems a genuin chance. There is definitely contact between Wiese in his followthrough and the ball, but Latham is well in. Credit for not backing up too far, and keeping his bat in the left hand so that he can push it back in quickly. Amid all that, Williamson has missed a straight driven boundary
shortish and outside off, patted away to point
another slower ball, at 124 kph, Williamson adjust mid-shot, and runs it down behind point

that is magnificent! He sure can punish poor bowling, this is just a bit too short at Wiese;s pace, and it is clear in the fact that Williamson has pulled off the front foot. But the intent to never keep the ball down, and to pick the gap well wide of long leg, wins it for the batsman

another lovely punch through the covers, as he beats the man on the in-field. There is some excitement though, as NZ take a late decision for a second. "Get off, Get off" someone yells to the man backing up, thinking the throw will hit direct.  But it doesn;t. Latham would have been out if it had. He had slipped running the first one
fuller delivery on the pads, clipped away through midwicket
fullish on off stump, Williamson drives to mid-on and his bat face closes too much on impact. Mistimed, clearly
back of a length and outside off, Williamson dabs and realises SA have placed a wide slip - Hashim Amla - for that very shot
full and angled in on off stump at 138 kph, blocked capably

another inside edge which skews away to mid-on. Williamson was looking more at a straight drive, and his bat face turns on impact. Is he feeling edgy? Abbott is keeping an excellent line, fullish more often than not, on off stump

dear me, he has split the wide slip and the keeper! Intentionally, I think. Picked up the ball being short of a length, and having a shade more room than Abbott has given so far. Plants the horizontal bat on it and rides it away to the third man boundary
and he starts off with a lovely, loopy... full toss. Latham only bunts it back at the bowler
a second one in a row, and this one was hip-high and well wide of off stump. Latham hammers it over the cow corner boundary
flighted, and lands in on leg stump, nudged to short fine leg. Missed out there, I think
lots of flight from Tahir, and he gets his line right, just outside off. Driven to mid-off
keeps bringing the batsman forward, Latham doesnt want to do something silly in the very first over of spin. Pushes it back to the bowler
nicely tossed up on off stump, capably defended
brilliant lines from Abbott, just a shade outside off, and Williamson can only push it into the extra cover region
extra bounce, but Williamson takes care of it well. Leaps up off his toes, softens his grip and drops it to point. Again, right on the money from Abbott, on and around off stump
ripper. Reward for sticking to his guns. Beats Williamson as he hits a good length and that newish ball holds its line. Could so easily have kissed the outside edge
bad follow up there as he goes too full and too straight, Williamson is off easy with a clip to deep square leg
nicely controlled from Latham, as he gets up to his full height and rolls his wrists on a short ball and sends it to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended stoutly
reads the length quickly and jumps back to work a short ball from off stump to deep square leg
quicker ball slips down leg, Williamson tries to tickle it fine, but finds short fine leg - Steyn
there is another rapid delivery, well directed this time. Williamson has to hurry into a back-foot defensive, and for his sure-footedness, he gets a single
flighted just outside off, defended
drifting down leg and Latham sweeps the fuller ball at short fine leg
stays back to a fuller one and plays a late cut - poor shot selection to a fuller ball - even if he realised it was the quicker one and wanted to use the pace. Missed
full and straight from Rabada to start his second spell, Williamson nudges it straight of midwicket
back of a length and outside off at 137 kph, chopped to point. South Africa are still persisting with a slip, good call
edges forward to a good length ball and blocks into the covers
loves the width, which is very clear in the way he throws his hands at it (imagine a flying, tackle hug), and finds a boundary behind point
shortish and outside off, not quite as far as the last time, so Latham runs it down to third man with only a slightly angled straight bat
ducks the ball back in off a shortish length to cramp Williamson, who defends awkwardly and has to be wary that the ball doesnt bounce onto his stumps

oopsy, the  square leg umpire in danger there. Gould has to become a crumpled heap as this pull homes in right at his head. Short ball from Tahir, gets the treatment and umpire Gould grins, happy that he didn;t get the treatment too
flighted just outside off, Williamson leans forward to block
flighted onto the stumps, Williamson drives to long-on
brings him forward, much better chance of a wicket that way, but Latham is solid with his block
a shade shortish and just outside off, defended

dropped by Miller. What is going on in this series? Two of the best units making silly mistakes. He seemed to have it all under control, running in from deep midwicket, got two hands to it as he goes in for the slide, and then it just pops out. Did he lose it in the crowd? Did something distract him? Either way, Williamson gets away with a pull. Shot was on considering the ball was short, but he should have kept it down
shortish on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
shortish on and around off stump, Latham defends with soft hands and the ball barely moves past his legs
shortish and on the hips, Latham eases it through square leg

good work from the slip fielder, AB leaps to his right to control a delicate little dab from KW. Those back of a length balls on the fourth stump dont seem to pose the same threat to him as it does other batsmen
flighted and drifted away outside off, Latham is forward defending with pad and bat together
flatter delivery outside off, pulled to deep square leg
gets some dip this time on middle, Williamson is watchful. Waits on it and then flicks it through mdiwciket
he wants to flight the ball, but the odd one slips out as a low full toss and Latham sweeps to deep square leg
stays back to a shortish delivery on middle, tapped to long-on
141kph, fullish on off stump, to keep that slip in play, Williamson though puts him out of play with a lovely forward defensive
beautiful bowling. Hits the length that brings Williamson forward, hits a line that is close enough to off stump to make him play, then it hits the seam and leaps away past the outside edge
full and a shade outside off, Williamson moves across and drives to mid-on
goes a little over the top with that bouncer at 139 kph, too much height, too far down leg. Williamson can simply duck and take a run for his team

steep bounce surprises the batsman. Williamson controls it well, if a little late. he doesn;t become flustered from the ball does something off the ordinary. Keeps his cool, softens his grip, makes sure to ride the bounce and keep it down to the slip fielder

terrific bowling from Rabada. He is pacy, he gets that disconcerting bounce and he beats Latham;s outside edge here. This is especially good because it was full, but it carries through to the keeper at head-hight
back of a length on off stump, defended
steps out of his crease to turn a fuller ball into a full toss, clipped through midwicket
that one goes on with the arm, doesnt turn. Latham defends it to point and has to send his captain back. No single there, Kane
shortish on middle and leg, clipped towards square leg
nicely tossed up on middle, Williamson keeps legside of it and punches to long-on
flighted just outside off and lures him into a poke, this is the googly as well from around the wicket. Latham has not picked it and gets a little edge to point. Beautifully bowled
leans forward into a fuller delivery outside off and drives down the ground for a single
fuller delivery outside off, crisply driven through the covers

oooh, has it worked? Almost. I wonder if Steyn has misjudged this catch. It was a steepler, and he was tracking it over his shoulder while running towards the long-off boundary. KW had mistimed the lift, and it went a little too high instead of long. But the fielder moved to his right, instead of towards the left where the ball was heading and ends up not being able to reach it
short on middle and leg, Williamson rocks back and pummels the ball to the midwicket boundary. No holds barred there
back of a length on middle and off, defended

another mistimed lift, another drop, this one by Rabada. He was racing forward from deep cover, had his eyes on it, but went  for a dive. A needless one it seems, which robs him of his balance and the ball sneaks past his cupped hands, rolls along his elbows and falls onto the turf
short and a shade wide, Latham slaps it behind point
flighted on middle, defended
gets down the track to tuck a fuller delivery to short midwicket
advances on the bowler again, but Tahir shortens his length and KW can only nudge it to short fine leg

does him in! Tahir is beside himself as he takes a lap of honour, with his team-mates struggling to catch up. This is the googly, which sneaks under Williamsons bat as he charged down the track looking for the old extra-cover loft. Misses it altogether and has his off stump knocked back
just wide of cover. Full delivery outside off which has Worker driving uppishly which doesn't evade cover by too much.
good length to begin, some fire in Steyn's run up. Drifts on Worker's pads though, and Worker works it down to fine leg
fifty for Latham. Good innings, giving NZ a lot of hope. Length delivery outside off, Latham plays it late with an angled bat to third man
excellent short delivery. Aimed right at Worker's throat. Worker manages to get under it however just in time

generating some good pace here is Steyn. Pitches on a good length on middle, climbs on Worker who awkwardly pats it to point at Rossouw who fields well but throws unnecessarily at the non-strikers end. Abbott covers up the throw excellently, saved some runs
short and wide, cut away sweetly but straight to point
good length again and the ball has rising from that length the whole day. Bounces extra once more but Latham stand stall and plays it down well.
huge appeal, but not given. What happened there? Enough doubt not to be given. pitches on a fullish length outside off, spinning in and Worker may have been struck outside the line
drilled to long-on off the front foot
lots of miscommunication but both make their grounds. Worked towards long-on with the spin, Worker is late to react and de Villiers' throw lacks pace
flighted on off stump, Worker tries to smash it over Tahir's head but skews it off the inner half of the bat to long-on
fullish length on middle, Latham drives to long-on with the turn
the googly this time, pitches on off spinning away from the left-hander. Worker plays it with soft hands to point to get one
144.7 ks, full on middle and leg. Hustles Worker for pace, but he gets behind the line of the delivery and blocks
drags his length back, ends up a bit short and wide, Worker stays on top of the ball and cuts all along the ground past Rossouw at point
length once more. Very good length. Coming in to the batsman a touch, Latham defends to point
a touch fuller on a fifth-stump line, good lines and lengths continue. Latham gets a thick outside edge or the outer half of the bat as the ball rolls to third man
140 ks, fuller than a good length this time but a touch of width. Worker throws his hands at it but is beaten because of the bounce
short and wide this time, a genuine scoring opportunity missed. Worker is beaten on the cut once more.

gone, needless wicket this, of the set Latham too. Slower offcutter on off stump. Latham shuffles across and works the ball with soft hands to square leg, Latham wants two immediately and sets off for the second with a bit of a slip at the non-strikers end. Miller at square leg runs in and underarms an accurate throw at the strikers end to find Latham inches short.
almost hits the leg stump. Elliott lazily walks very far outside off, Wiese cleverly fires it down leg and just misses that leg stump.
nicely played this time, a bit too attacking maybe from de Villiers. Had the mid-on fielder more towards midwicket, Elliott drills the fullish length nicely down the ground for four.
shortish delivery on off stump, defended off the front foot
127 ks, slightly wider outside off on a good length. Elliott gets a good stride forward and chooses to leave
good length once more just outside off, Elliott stays on the front foot to defend with intent to point
excellent lines and length to begin, top-of-off stuff, Worker plays it nicely though, waits for he ball to come to him before delicately playing the ball to third man
short of a length on this occasion just outside off, not too pacey but the lines ensure Elliott can only pat the ball to point
well played and good run too. Length ball again around off, Elliott plays it down by his feet with soft hands and the pair mutually agree there is a single there
good short ball once again, well directed towards the badge. Worker is in two minds whether to pull or leave, and awkwardly leaves it in the end
fullish length outside off, played to point. Worker wants one but there is no run there
good shot on that occasion, advances down the track and meets the ball as it is rising from the good length. Lofts it well over mid-off for a boundary
another boundary. Well bowled from Wiese. Short ball on Elliott's ribs who tries to pull but kisses the glove and flies past the diving keeper
shortish length outside off, Elliott steers towards point but there is some midfielding
poor ball again from Wiese. Short and wide, Worker punishes the ball. Cuts neatly off the back foot behind backward point
slower offcutter outside the off stump, played delicately with an angled bat to third man
oh, Elliott creamed that delivery. Full and a bit wide of off stump, Elliott comes down and smashes the drive but Elgar at cover half-stops it. Good fielding
another poor delivery but Worker finds point this time. Short and wide, another scoring chance has been missed.
fullish length but slightly wide. Elliott pastes the cut to point
nicely played this time. Short but closer to off, Elliott guides it on its way down to third man uppishly. Elgar scampers across and stops the ball once again. Good fielding
beaten on the outside edge. Full delivery outside off, inviting the drive but there is some away shape which helps in taking the ball past Worker's outside edge. Good ball
good change in length once more, using the bouncer as a surprise weapon. Directs the bumper well, Worker sways out of the line nicely though, dropping his wrists
almost gets through. Would have been plumb had there not been an inside edge. Very full on off stump, Worker just manages to get bat on it
a bit full outside off and punished this time. Worker gets forward and drives it hard into the ground which bounces over cover for another boundary
slower offcutter on middle stump, Elliott nudges watchfully from off stump towards fine leg

125 ks, got im this time. Takes out the middle stump, Worker gets his feet in a tangle and the ball comes back at him a touch and full, the ball beats his inside edge and crashes into the stumps. Timely wicket for SA.
129 kph, short and wide to begin to Munro who cannot capitalise on the gift. He too is beaten on the outside edge due to the extra bounce
full and wide outside off, driven to cover with no feet movement
fullish but slightly wide. Guided off the front foot to third man. Maybe SA should bowl straighter to Elliott
just over point this time. Full and wide, Munro flays at the ball but it takes the outer half of the bat and flies over point. third man gets around to keep it to one
fullish outside off, a bit of away shape too. Good bowling that. Munro drives with no feet movement again. He is a real candidate for that outside edge to slip.
shorter on off stump, Munro stays back and works off his hips to deep square leg

what a shot. Really clever batting from Elliott. Short outside off, and sits up for Elliott who decides to ramp it with an angled bat, closes the face at point of contact allowing it to go the left of the keeper
shortish length on off, solidly defended off the front foot

was that dropped again? Another drop, good line outside off and Elliott throws his hands at it and gets a thick outside edge. Amla at slip gets the down to his left boot but spills another good chance. Very poor fielding on show here
plays it down on the ground with an angled bat towards Amla, who misfields at slip as it comes at an awkward length.
slower offcutter on middle, clipped off to midwicket for one
fullish length outside off, Munro dives to the right of cover who runs across and makes a good diving stop
smashed off the front foot this time towards the sweeper cover

taken this time. Rabada must have been under plenty of pressure there. Good length delivery outside off, Elliott walks across and flicks it in the air towards the square leg region. It hangs in the air for a while with the eyes of the world on Rabada's hands. He hangs on though to an easy catch.
shortish length outside off, Munro cuts nicely to the sweeper on the off side
119 ks, decent lines and lengths, just outside off. Ronchi watches it as it goes by
very full on leg to begin, Munro works off his pads to the vacant midwicket region for one
good length delivery which climbs once again, Ronchi tries to steer to point but is hit on the glove. Eventually rolls away to third man for one.
excellent line, top of off line on a fullish length, defended to cover off the front foot
another well-directed bouncer. Munro gets under it without much discomfort though.
fuller than a good length outside off, some really tight lines. Munro plays it with soft hands in front of de Villiers at cover. They get through for one

Amla takes the catch this time. The excellent lines has worked once again. Just outside off, may have shaped away a touch too. Ronchi can't help himself from prodding at it without much intent and gets a thick outside edge, which flies towards slip. Amla gets his hands in a good position and hangs on to his right with the reverse cup.
flighted delivery outside off, driven off the front foot to cover
a bit slow and wide, Munro gets back and cuts nicely to the sweeper
googly on leg stump, Bracewell doesn't pick it well enough and gets hit on the pads. Going well down leg
flat on middle, bowled quickly too. Bracewell works to midwicket
bowled through flat and quick again outside off, defended off the back foot
low full toss on off stump, drilled to long-on off the front foot
wide outside off on a fullish length, skewed off the front foot to cover
closer to off stump, worked away from off stump into the midwicket region, placed and timed it well enough to get two
full again outside off, Munro sweetly times the drive to point
on Munro's hips again, easily tucked off his pads to square leg
good length outside off, moving away from the right-hander. Bracewell gets a thick outside edge which goes down to third man
very full down leg side, beats Munro for pace and the ball strikes Munro on the leg. Van Wyk does well to collect it though
googly from outside off, cut away off the back foot to point
flighted delivery outside off, driven uppishly to cover, de Villiers does well to stop it though
googly on middle, driven off the front foot to midwicket
flat and quick on off stump, drilled to midwicket
fullish and driven to long-off off the front foot
flight, ends up as a low full toss. Munro clips in the air to long-on for another single
full on off stump, driven off the front foot to mid-off. The fielder gets across and half-stops it
fuller length outside off, outside edge goes down to third man
short and wide, crashed off the front foot in the air but one the bounce to the sweeper.
good length outside off, punchily driven to cover
very very good yorker on middle. Almost goes through Bracewell who gets bat down just in time. He falls over as he digs the ball out, beautifully done by Steyn.
slightly wider outside off, and short. Munro gets a thick outside edge which flies through gully for four.
good length outside off, hit nicely off the front foot but straight to point
four more. Slightly leg side-ish from Wiese on a good length, Bracewell stays back and wristily flicks in the air through backward square
slightly wide this time, nicely drive to the sweeper off the front foot
a bit wide again outside off, Munro stays back and drives into the off side
fullish length on off stump, Bracewell drives down to long-on
a bit short on this occasion on a slightly shortish length, Munro picks the length early and deposits it over midwicket for four. Nice stroke
full and quick outside off, Bracewell looks to smash over cover but gets another thick outside edge to third man
very full and quick, 144 ks, Munro stays on the front foot and defends towards midwicket
very full and wide outside off, a good wide yorker. Munro gets an under edge which goes to the keeper
fullish once more just outside off, driven off the front foot to cover. Really quick now Steyn.
quick again, slightly fuller on off, Munro can only hit it back to the bowler. The bat face closed as he made contact with that
good bouncer, well directed on middle stump. Munro prematurely gets under it
was that the wrong un? Certainly had a lot of flight and was tossed up way wide of off stump. Bracewell smears it through the covers
drags this short, but it doesnt give the batsman the room he might like. Munro has to be content with a push to long-on
catch it, yells Tahir, as the flick goes towards short midwicket. Beat the tail-ender in the pace flight as Bracewell got into the shot too early. Doesnt carry

thought it was shorter than it was, and Bracewell only pulls the ball down to Amla at deep square leg. Cant sit around plodding when the run-rate is over 10 per over. This one doesnt come off, and NZ sink a little lower
seems to be the googly again, Munro set up for the one coming back in as he was looking for a cover drive. But the ball turns away and takes the outside edge
good first-impression from Milne, as he leans into a powerful drive through the covers. Some work for the sweeper there, who does well to keep it to three
bowls fast, bowls full and gets the inswinger going. Rather like his idol, Steyn. Milne, who dishes these out himself, just manages to keep his castle safe
sucks him into a drive outside off and is beaten by this fuller ball holding its line
back of a length on middle, can only be defended by the No. 9
keeps to his crease to negotiate a short delivery on middle, sliced to point. "Get him on the front foot, KG," call his team-mates
and so he does and Milne is comfortably beaten. Hits a deck on a fuller length and the ball strays from its angle in, holds its line instead, and misses the outside edge
pulls his length back again, and Milne blocks. Thats a maiden in the 43rd over, gets a pat on the back from Steyn too

ooh, he did well there, but the ball bounces just short of Behardien at deep square leg. Brilliant pick-up shot first up from Munro to take it that far. The fielder tracks it down on his left, races forward as well and dives, but it is just not enough
back of a length and outside off, dabbed into the off side
hit on the bottom of the bat as Munro slaps a full toss down to long-on. Calls for a new one, oh, actually it seems to be for tape. Very dull clunk as the ball hit bat
goes for the pull, but the short ball reaches him a bit too quickly. Gets a single towards long-on, when he wanted midwicket
fearsome short ball from Abbott - fast, accurate and high enough to threaten the batsmans throat - Munro goes for the pull, is quite late on it, and it is comfortably beaten
full and just outside off, pushed to mid-off
out comes the short ball, and Munro liked it. Leaped up to try and ramp it over third man, but cant reach as far.
full and just outside off, Munro had made room to slice the ball through the off side, ends up with an inside edge to long-on

ooh, thats good work from Steyn! His head was in threat as he slid into a dive, but the ball hit the turf and reared up at him. But the reverse cup works and he saves his looks, and a boundary, and wears a smile
drags a short ball from outside off towards midwicket, but he makes poor contact. Very little power in the shot and Miller takes a simple catch at mid-on. Missed a catch earlier
nowhere near the line of the shortish delivery outside off, but he goes for a waft and is easily beaten

drags on, the series win is that much closer for South Africa. It is the slower ball, a little bit of an offcutter. Munro looks to clear his front leg and heave it over the leg side, only ends up with an inside edge leading to the dreaded rattle
a neat little leg glance to get him off the mark as Wiese slips the slowe rball down leg
that looks like the legcutter, which Wheeler lifts over point to find his first boundary
no pace offered to the tailenders, but Wheeler is happy facing these. Stays leg side and taps it through the covers
promisingly full, but terribly wide of leg stump. The tailender chases after it and misses
slower ball, Sodhi backs away for an ugly swipe and is lucky to have his middle stump standing
more changes of pace, this time it is the slower bouncer, which Sodhi tries to ramp but makes no contact
back of a length at 143 kph, Wheeler stays beside it and dabs to deep third man

huge appeal for leg before, the line was perfect, but there seems to be an inside edge here. Steyn makes the symbol for DRS, but it isnt operating here. Sodhi pinned in his crease, beaten for pace, but did get enough bat on it
nice and full and swinging in to Sodhi, who in turn raises his stocks by playing a lovely push down the ground
banged in short, right over middle at 142 kph, Sodhi ducks under and the Durban crowd goes "Ohhhhh"
another bouncer, but this is sliding down leg and Steyn will have to bowl it again
back of a length on off stump, Sodhi finds a single in the covers
thumped past mid-off! The fuller ball seeking top of off has been dispatched with some authority. All hands though, seeing as Wheeler and his feet were rooted outside leg
just short of a good length on off stump, Sodhi pushes it to cover
outside edge skirts away to third man as Sodhi brings his bat across from gully onto the back of a length ball on middle.
looks to force it down the ground, but the fuller delivery was a touch too quick for him to time it. Mid-off is on hand to take care of things
banged in short just outside off, Sodhi sinks under it
looks for timber with a pretty full ball on the base of leg stump, slower in pace though, Sodhi drives through extra cover
clears his front leg and swipes a fuller ball on middle to deep midwicket
good length ball just outside off, scrambled seam as well, gets it to hold its line and beat the tailender push
third slips leaps to his right, but he cant pull back this glide from Wheeler off a fuller ball on off stump
dabs towards third man, but third slip gets in the way again. Steyn seems content bowling a length, instead of the yorker
goes for the bouncer here, which the tall Sodhi gets behind, and knocks into the off side for a quick single
shortish on off stump, Wheeler runs it to third slip
goes full on off stump, but the batsman is able to keep his stumps intact
shortish on off stump, Sodhi gets an inside edge off a swipe square on the leg side

picks up the length ball and lofts it, the only problem though is that he has picked out long-on. Looked nice as Sodhi cleared his front leg to go for the big hit, but he hasnt been able to put the power behind it. South Africa seal the series 2-1
